blurb: Phix is a remarkably simple yet full-featured programming language with clear syntax and plain English errors. It was the first in which 100% of all rosettacode tasks were completed, still one of only two. A hybrid interpreter/compiler/transpiler approach allows a fast development cycle, and native executables for Windows and Linux, and html/js/css for running in a web browser.

key_features.title: Safe
key_features.content: Extensive error checking with full descriptions, stack trace, and a dump of variable values.

key_features.title: Cross-platform
key_features.content: Phix programs run under Windows, Linux, and any platform with a web browser.

key_features.title: Expressive
key_features.content: Routines are naturally generic, allowing for flexibility in handling different data types.

key_features.title: Easy
key_features.content: A remarkably simple, flexible, powerful language definition that is easy to learn and use.

key_features.title: Fast
key_features.content: A high-performance interpreter, and compilation to native binaries.

key_features.title: Documentation
key_features.content: Documentation is extensive, making it easy to get started with Phix.
